definition: a person in a law case who is accused of having done something illegal
(often of something bad) intentional or planned
training to act in accordance with rules, drill; activity, exercise, or a regimen that develops or improves a skill; punishment inflicted by way of correction and training
to send something, especially goods or a message, somewhere for a particular purpose
an argument or disagreement, especially an official one between, for example, workers and employers or two countries with a common border
an area of interest or an area over which a person has control
a drawing, sketch, or design; a first or preliminary form of any writing, subject to revision, copying, etc.
expected to happen, arrive, etc. at a particular time; owed at present; having reached the date for payment
